Representative_Docs: ["Kerr groups ready to help feed families cut off from SNAP due to shutdown Approximately 2,000 in Kerr County have not received November SNAP credits to their card since benefits ran out in October. Although the federal government shutdown is interfering with the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program that helps millions of low-income families, Kerr County food assistance partners stand ready to fill the gap. In Kerr County, 2,013 households totaling 4,082 individuals have not received November SNAP credits to their card since benefits ran out in October, according to the Texas Health and Human Services Department. Faced with costly flights and crowded airports, millions of Americans are choosing the open road this holiday season. A new survey from the RV Industry Association shows 28 million Americans plan to travel by RV this winter, a 33% increase over last year. The jump reflects growing demand for cost-effective and flexible vacation options as inflation and unpredictable travel logistics continue to impact holiday plans. Representative_Docs: ["Six Players Ejected After Massive Brawl During St. John's vs. Providence As a subscriber, you can share up to 3 articles each month with friends for free. Just click ‚ÄúGift this Article‚Äù on this page, then copy the link or enter their email. Gifts are exclusive to subscribers, reset monthly, and each article can be redeemed once. A legitimate brawl broke out during the second half of this Saturday's game between No. 17 St. John's and Providence. With over 14:25 remaining in the second half, St. John's forward Bryce Hopkins went up for a layup when he was grabbed in midair by Providence's Duncan Powell. Not only did Powell hack Hopkins, he basically threw him to the floor. While we can't say for sure what his intentions were, it certainly looked dirty from the broadcast angle. Reed Bailey came off the bench to add 17 points and eight rebounds, while Nick Dorn contributed 15 points on 5-of-11 shooting from the 3-point line. The Hoosiers (9-3) drew assists on all but two of their 26 field goals, with Conor Enright dishing out seven and Wilkerson handing out six. Name: 2_passed away_anthony_funeral_joe
Representative_Docs: ['Anthony Duarte Birth: 1980 Death: 2025 Anthony Duarte, of La Puente, California, passed away on Wednesday, October 29, 2025, surrounded by love and family. Born on June 9, 1980, in West Covina, California, to Doreen Cardenas and Gildardo Duarte, Anthony was raised with deep love and guidance, and shared a profoundly special bond with his father Robert Cardenas, who helped shape the man he became. Anthony lived a life marked by warmth, creativity, and generosity. His kindness was as constant as his humor, and he approached every day with an open heart and an unwavering sense of purpose. Anthony‚Äôs passions reflected his deep belief in connection ‚Äî through both community and service. He had a profound dedication to civic life, demonstrated by his years of service on the Hacienda La Puente Unified School Board, his time working for a member of Congress, and his contributions to the California Democratic Party. Through these roles, he championed education, representation, and opportunity for others, always guided by empathy and integrity. Anthony cared deeply for his friends and made a lasting impact on everyone lucky enough to know him. He was the first to reach out when someone needed support and al', 'Anthony Duarte Birth: 1980 Death: 2025 Anthony Duarte, of La Puente, California, passed away on Wednesday, October 29, 2025, surrounded by love and family. Name: 3_surgery_hospitals_nhs_medical
Representative_Docs: ['VIDEO: $5.5M robotic surgery system arrives at Surrey Memorial Hospital Published 12:10 pm Tuesday, January 27, 2026 By Anna Burns The da Vinci Xi System has been unpacked and calibrated and is being held in a temporary location until its permanent location is finished. Fraser Health said that it expects it to ‚Äúgo-live‚Äù later in the spring. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Health care workers pose in front of the da Vinci Xi System. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Surrey Memorial Hospital is one step closer to providing robotic-assisted surgery with the arrival of the da Vinci Xi Robotic Surgery system. It is expected to be used in surgeries in the spring. ‚ÄúWith the aid of the da Vinci Xi system, we can expand minimally invasive thoracic and foregut surgery, and we can do operations with greater precision and accuracy,‚Äù says Dr Ahmad Ashrafi, regional division head and chief of thoracic surgery for Fraser Health. ‚ÄúPatients may experience quicker recovery times, and we can carry out more complex procedures right here in Surrey, using minimally invasive techniques. This advanced technology will also help us attract and retain top surgical talent at Surrey Memorial Hospital.‚Äù Construction is underway on an operating room', 'VIDEO: $5.5M robotic surgery system arrives at Surrey Memorial Hospital Published 12:10 pm Tuesday, January 27, 2026 By Anna Burns The da Vinci Xi System has been unpacked and calibrated and is being held in a temporary location until its permanent location is finished. Name: 4_friendships_friendship_friends_friend
Representative_Docs: ['Asking Eric: I‚Äôm annoyed that friend, IRL, never comments or ‚Äòlikes‚Äô my online posts Dear Eric: I have a friend I‚Äôve known for four years. We all live in a 55+ community and have moved here from different areas of the country. We are a group of women who get together on a regular basis for outings. Over the past couple of months, I feel somewhat left out because of a couple of events I wasn‚Äôt included in. But what I‚Äôm trying to understand is why does she not ‚Äúlike‚Äù or comment on any of my Facebook posts when she‚Äôs all over everyone else‚Äôs with supportive and loving comments? Again, this is so silly, but I can‚Äôt help wondering why. When I look back at my posts, I noticed she has never acknowledged any of them, even for my birthday. We are still friends, we work with the same fundraising group, have dinner at each other‚Äôs house and get invited to the same events. This Facebook thing has got me confused and I don‚Äôt know what kind of friend she is so I‚Äôm getting uncomfortable around her. So now, what am I doing? Ignoring her posts, which makes me feel so stupid and juvenile. If I wasn‚Äôt part of this group, which I really like, I wouldn‚Äôt bother with her. Can you shed any light on her mindset? It‚Äôs really got me confused. ‚Äì Friend Request Dear Friend: Even though social', 'Asking Eric: After 6 years sober, man is frustrated by his family‚Äôs hold on their hurt and distrust Dear Eric: I‚Äôve just turned 40 this past year. The last 15 years I was in a horrible drug addiction. I lied and hurt and did terrible things to a lot of people, especially my family. About eight years ago they officially disowned me. Understandable. I‚Äôve cleaned up and got my act together six years ago. At first, I tried to force my way back into their lives, which all refuted. I lashed out, said horrible things and stopped trying to be in their lives. My mom will stop by on my birthday for 10 minutes or so and drop a card off at Christmas. As for my two older brothers and my father, it‚Äôs radio silence. I guess what I‚Äôm asking is, what do I do to fix this and fast, as I said I‚Äôve turned 40 this year, my parents are both 70. Time is running out, and I couldn‚Äôt imagine living my life without some kind of acceptance from my father. Or knowing he did or does love me. My heart breaks at the thought, but this is a real pickle. How can I fix a problem when the ones I need to fix it with won‚Äôt talk to me? Do I just keep ignoring their existence and put on this fa√ßade that I don‚Äôt care to my wife and 4-year-old son? What picture am I painting to my son, as he‚Äôs been guilty by association yo', 'Asking Eric: Can mom work through tension in son‚Äôs relationship with dad so they can celebrate special birthday? Dear Eric: My son is turning 40 on December 22. My husband and I are at a quandary as to how to celebrate him. There have been issues between my husband and him over things from his childhood. We did a special trip for his older brother when he turned 40 and would like to do something special for this son‚Äôs 40th as well. Our daughter-in-law has made special plans for him and we are not included. I understand that, but I need some ideas as to how to celebrate this extra special year without rocking the boat. I love my son with all my heart, as I do all my children, and want his 40th birthday to be memorable in a positive way. Any suggestions? ‚Äì Mom Who Wants to Celebrate Dear Mom: The issues your son and your husband are having may be an obstacle, but they aren‚Äôt insurmountable. And the thing that can get them on the path to resolution is the same thing that can get you answers about how to celebrate your son: open communication. It‚Äôs not within your purview to try to fix things between them, but you have your own relationship with your son and so I‚Äôd encourage you to reach out and tell him what you told me: you want to celebrate him, you know things are difficult, and you‚Äôre lookin']

Name: 5_actress_cast_horror_movie
Representative_Docs: ['Evan Peters gives update on ‚ÄòAmerican Horror Story\' with Ariana Grande ‚ÄúWicked: For Good‚Äù is now available to watch at home, thanks to a digital release that also includes exclusive behind-the-scenes content ‚Äì including bringing the incredible costumes to life. Originally appeared on E! Online. Evan Peters is getting into position for Ariana Grande to join "American Horror Story." Watch NBC Bay Area News free wherever you are Following the Halloween 2025 announcement that the "Wicked: For Good" actress will star alongside the Emmy winner in season 13 of the anthology series, he detailed the benefit of having Grande join the Ryan Murphy show. ‚ÄúWhat doesn\'t she bring to the cast?‚Äù Peters, who with Grande in her ‚Äúwe can‚Äôt be friends‚Äù music video, told E! News‚Äô Will Marfuggi in an exclusive interview. ‚ÄúShe\'s an incredible performer and actress, and I think that\'s gonna be awesome to have her on board.‚Äù And the "Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story" actor is looking forward to what the future has in store with Grande ‚Äî who previously starred in Murphy\'s 2015 show "Scream Queens" ‚Äî and the rest of the cast, including AHS alums Jessica Lange, Kathy Bates and Emma Roberts. He‚Äôs particularly eager to see how Murphy utilizes all of Grande‚Äôs different talents for t', "AP Entertainment SummaryBrief at 3:08 p.m. EST Brendan Fraser's new horizons include 'Rental Family' and rental hedgehogs BEDFORD, N.Y. (AP) ‚Äî ‚ÄúRental Family‚Äù is Brendan Fraser‚Äôs first leading role since winning the best actor Oscar for ‚ÄúThe Whale.‚Äù In it, the 56-year-old plays a struggling actor living in Japan who, out of desperation and curiosity, takes a job with an agency that hires out actors to fulfill roles in real people‚Äôs lives. In an interview, Fraser discusses his life since the Oscar win, his eye-opening experiences in Japan and what returning to the ‚ÄúMummy‚Äù series means to him. His time in Japan included a visit to a hedgehog cafe. ‚ÄúRental Family‚Äù opens Friday in theaters. Movie Review: Joel Edgerton delivers a profound, understated performance in ‚ÄòTrain Dreams‚Äô Joel Edgerton plays a logger at the beginning of the 20th century in ‚ÄúTrain Dreams.‚Äù Clint Bentley's film is an adaptation of Denis Johnson's novella, about the toll of progress and the people left behind. Edgerton stars alongside Felicity Jones and William H. Macy in the meditative film. In her review, Associated Press Film Writer Lindsey Bahr praises Edgerton's understated performance and adds that, ‚ÄúBentley‚Äôs film is haunting and patient, a dreamlike jo", "AP Entertainment SummaryBrief at 3:08 p.m. EST Brendan Fraser's new horizons include 'Rental Family' and rental hedgehogs BEDFORD, N.Y. Name: 6_fabric_luxurious_luxury_pigment
Representative_Docs: ['The darkest fabric ever made is now a dress Get the Popular Science daily newsletterüí° Breakthroughs, discoveries, and DIY tips sent every weekday. Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. There is black, and then there is ultrablack. The shade defined as a black that reflects less than 0.5 percent of the light that hits it, is used on everything from telescopes to cameras. This uniquely dark color is not easy to produce and may appear less black when it is viewed at an angle. To find a better way to reproduce this cool color, a team at Cornell University looked to nature. Specifically, a bird called the magnificent riflebird. The result is the darkest known fabric ever created and it is detailed in a study recently published in the journal Nature Communications. The magnificent riflebird is a large songbird and member of the bird-of-paradise family found in New Guinea and Australia. Male riflebirds are almost completely black, with a green and blue metallic sheen on their belly, throat, and crown feathers. With the help of Mary M. Ferraro and Vanya Rohwer from the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, the team studied the riflebird‚Äôs black feathers. Their plumage comes from melanin pigment paired with tightly bunched filaments called barb', "Sam's Club Is Selling a Versatile 12-Drawer Organizer That's a Serial Hobbyist's Dream Come True As a subscriber, you can share up to 3 articles each month with friends for free. Just click ‚ÄúGift this Article‚Äù on this page, then copy the link or enter their email. Gifts are exclusive to subscribers, reset monthly, and each article can be redeemed once. Parade aims to feature only the best products and services. If you buy something via one of our links, we may earn a commission. I'm calling it now: 2026 will be the year of hobbies. Whether you love crafting, building LEGO sets, sewing, painting, putting together puzzles, crocheting or all of the above, there are plenty of different hobbies you can get into this year. Of course, many of these activities require supplies that can easily get scattered about and disorganized (looking at you LEGO bricks). This may lead to more clutter and chaos in the home‚Äîsomething no one wants. That's why before you start a new hobby it can be helpful to think about a storage solution for all of your hobby essentials. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Name: 7_museum_egypt_egyptian_world largest
Representative_Docs: ["Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization CAIRO (AP) ‚Äî Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world‚Äôs largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. World leaders, including monarchs, heads of states and governments, are set to attend the grand opening ceremony, according to the Egyptian presidency which touted the museum as ‚Äúan exceptional event in the history of human culture and civilization.‚Äù The museum is one of the megaprojects championed by President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi since he took office in 2014. He has embarked on massive investments in infrastructure with the aim of reviving an economy weakened by decades of stagnation and battered by the unrest that followed the 2011 Arab Spring uprising. Preparations for the grand reveal have been shrouded in secrecy. The museum, which was opened for limited visits in recent years, has been closed for the past two weeks. The government has revamped the a", "Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization CAIRO (AP) ‚Äî Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world‚Äôs largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. World leaders, including monarchs, heads of states and governments, are set to attend the grand opening ceremony, according to the Egyptian presidency which touted the museum as ‚Äúan exceptional event in the history of human culture and civilization.‚Äù The museum is one of the megaprojects championed by President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi since he took office in 2014. He has embarked on massive investments in infrastructure with the aim of reviving an economy weakened by decades of stagnation and battered by the unrest that followed the 2011 Arab Spring uprising. Preparations for the grand reveal have been shrouded in secrecy. The museum, which was opened for limited visits in recent years, has been closed for the past two weeks. The government has revamped the a", "Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world‚Äôs largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. Name: 8_immigration_britain_immigrants_societal
Representative_Docs: ['‚ÄòUK public have tougher stance on immigration and diversity than people in US‚Äô People in the UK are less likely than their US counterparts to feel diversity strengthens society and more likely to have tougher attitudes on immigration, according to research. The findings are said to show that a common narrative about Britain being more socially liberal than America does not ring true across all issues. The National Centre for Social Research also found Reform UK voters in Britain were more likely than supporters of President Donald Trump in the US to say immigrants living in their country without permission should not be allowed to stay. While seven in 10 supporters of Mr Trump felt this way, the figure was almost eight in 10 (79%) among Reform followers. The researchers said they wanted to ‚Äúbetter understand how public attitudes in the UK compare with those in the US, and the extent of polarisation in the two countries‚Äù. Their survey found 42% of people in the UK think there should be legal efforts to deport immigrants living here without permission, compared with just a third (33%) in the US. While almost two-thirds (64%) of respondents in the US felt diversity strengthens society, only around half (49%) of the UK public agreed. Proportions were similar when', '‚ÄòUK public have tougher stance on immigration and diversity than people in US‚Äô People in the UK are less likely than their US counterparts to feel diversity strengthens society and more likely to have tougher attitudes on immigration, according to research. Name: 9_tvs_monitor_display_screen
Representative_Docs: ["Forget Micro RGB: I saw TCL's new SQD-Mini LED TV, and it's the model to beat at CES Follow ZDNET: Add us as a preferred source on Google. This year's CES is indisputably the Micro RGB show. Virtually every major TV manufacturer is incorporating the tri-colored pixel technology, as if the transparent TVs from last year are no longer cutting-edge. TCL has other plans. Also: CES 2026 news: Live updates on TVs, smart glasses, robots, and more we've seen so far The brand's new crown jewel TV of 2026 is the X11L, which features TCL's Super Quantum Dot (SQD) Mini LED panel, for which the company claims achieves 100 percent of the BT2020 color gamut. This is accomplished by pairing the SQD layer with a CSOT UltraColor Filter, as well as an Advanced Color Purity Algorithm. If that assembly of tech jargon doesn't tell you it's CES (or that TCL means business), then I don't know what will. Effectively, the X11L solves a major pain point with conventional Micro RGB TVs: color blooming, or color crosstalk. With Micro RGB TVs often emitting very bright light, certain colors can bleed into surrounding dark areas, reducing color accuracy. With the CSOT UltraColor Filter, TCL has significantly reduced these artifacts, rendering images that, to my fresh-off-a-plane eyes, appeared c", 'Samsung OLED 48S95H: New 48-inch and 165 Hz OLED TV revealed ahead of schedule with HDR10 Plus Advanced support Samsung has already teased plenty of devices on the eve of CES 2026. However, the trade show has decided to lift the lid on one of Samsung\'s forthcoming OLED Smart TVs. For context, Samsung listed numerous unreleased Smart TVs on its Parts Database over a month ago. Of those, CES has announced that the S95H is a 2026 Honoree in its Gaming & eSports category. Specifically, the trade show has signalled out a 48-inch variant that was missing from November\'s leak. Incidentally, last year\'s S95F only went as small as 55-inches (curr. $1,997 on Amazon). According to the listing, the S95H offers a 165 Hz refresh rate with VRR technology supported. Assuming a 4K resolution from the S95F series and the usage of HDMI 2.1 ports, a 165 Hz refresh rate would require the usage of Display Stream Compression (DSC) to output at its peak resolution and refresh rate simultaneously. Moreover, the new 48-inch Smart TV will support Samsung\'s new HDR10 Plus Advanced format. Pricing and availability are unknown for now; the full description provided by Samsung and CES is as follows: The Samsung OLED (S95H) is the world\'s most advanced 48" OLED TV for high-end gaming. Combining unparalleled brightness and', "World's largest monitor company designed a 4K 48-inch OLED dual-sided smart gaming display with metal feet, a magnetic power socket, and an Alienware-inspired sound system - but who will actually use it? Sign up for breaking news, reviews, opinion, top tech deals, and more. You are now subscribed Your newsletter sign-up was successful GP TV has unveiled what it calls the world‚Äôs first dual-sided 48-inch 4K OLED television, designed for gaming and sports viewing. The display is intended to deliver immersive experiences on both sides simultaneously, with built-in audio and dynamic lighting effects. TPV Technology Group, the company behind GP TV, claims the screen targets premium users who value high-end visual fidelity, as well as the public sector and government institutions. This design feels unusual because most monitors or televisions sit against a wall or on a desk, making a rear-facing display largely unnecessary. Its relevance only emerges if the screen stands in the center of a room, similar to display setups commonly seen in shopping malls - and even then, deploying such a device in public spaces would increase the risk of physical damage, leaving the practical use case for this product uncertain. It comes with an audio system that integrates surround sound, Dolby Atmos support, and sound tracking that follows on-screen action. Speakers with fabric covers on both sides creat"]

Name: 10_welfare_labour_social security_benefits
Representative_Docs: ['How much will DWP benefits and pensions rise following the budget? Benefits Budget 2025 Child Benefit Department for Work and Pensions DWP Pensions PIP Rachel Reeves Universal Credit National government Personal Finance DWP benefits including Universal Credit, Child Benefit, PIP, Carer\'s Allowance, and the State Pension are to increase in April 2026 after Rachel Reeves announced higher payments in her budget speech today. Anyone who claims DWP benefits should be in line for an increase in the next financial year, as the chancellor laid out plans to help pensioners, disabled people, parents, low earners, carers and unemployed people keep up with rising costs. Addressing MPs, Ms Reeves said: "The broken welfare system that we inherited wrote off millions of people as too sick to work and we will reform that system so that it is a system that does not count the cost of failure, but one that protects people who cannot work and empowers those who can. "We have brought back face-to-face assessments for disability benefits. Those are the face-to-face assessments that the shadow chancellor (Sir Mel Stride) got rid of when he was work and pensions secretary and our changes we have made to Universal Credit will get 15,000 people back into work, a figure con', 'How much will DWP benefits and pensions rise following the budget? Name: 11_olympic_opening ceremony_hockey_events
Representative_Docs: ["Olympic torch to crisscross Italy on 12,000 kilometer journey The Olympic torch will go on a 12,000 kilometer journey across Italy in the two months leading up to the Winter Olympics in February, Games organizers said on Monday. The relay will take in famous tourist spots including the Colosseum in Rome and the Grand Canal in Venice, as well as stopping in southern cities such as Palermo and Naples to spark excitement in areas where winter sports are not a major feature. The Games will be co-hosted by Milan and the Dolomite resort of Cortina d'Ampezzo and will run from Feb. 6 to 22. ‚ÄúEvery step of the relay through our cities will remind the world of the power of sport to build bridges and break down barriers,‚Äù said Giovanni Malago, president of the Milano Cortina 2026 Foundation, adding that the journey would celebrate ‚Äúthe essence of Italy.‚Äù The torch relay will begin on Nov. 26 when the flame is lit in Olympia, the Greek home of the ancient Games. The flame will be handed over to Italian officials in Athens on Dec. 4 and begin its Italian trip from Rome two days later. It will be in Naples for Christmas, see in the New Year in the southern city of Bari, and reach Cortina on Jan. 26 ‚Äî exactly 70 years after the opening ceremony of the 1956", '2026 welcomed with open arms across Canada Kelowna rang in the New Year with style at its annual New York New Year‚Äôs celebrations in Stuart Park. The family-oriented event had live music on offer, as well as skating on the outdoor ice rink, drop-in games and activities in the Kiwanis Snow Zone. Revelers enjoyed free hot chocolate and cookies, food trucks, and, of course, fireworks that went off at 9 p.m. so all ages could enjoy. B.C. cities and towns were the last to bid adieu to 2025, nationwide. Canadians in Newfoundland were the first to ring in 2026, including residents of St. John\'s. The city hosted a series of New Year\'s Eve celebrations culminating in a classic midnight countdown and fireworks. In Montreal, the night was billed as "Le Grand Minuit," featuring lights, music and what organizers described as a whole lot of winter magic in the city\'s historic Old Port. In Toronto, pop-up performances and entertainment could be found in every neighbourhood, with the festive countdown and fireworks taking place on the city\'s waterfront. Across the Prairies and territories, major cities and small towns rang in the new year with a slew of family-friendly activities, live entertainment, local food trucks, fireworks and more.', 'Team USA Women‚Äôs Ice Hockey: How to Watch the 2026 Winter Olympics Event Live Online for Free If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, The Hollywood Reporter may receive an affiliate commission. The 2026 Winter Olympics officially starts on Friday, Feb. 6 with the opening ceremony in Milano Cortina, Italy. However, there are a few events, like curling, that start early for group play, preliminaries and qualifying rounds. Countries, like Sweden, Germany, France, Italy, United States and others, compete in Women‚Äôs Ice Hockey to start the medal tournament. In addition, this is the first Winter Olympics featuring pro players from the PWHL (Professional Women‚Äôs Hockey League) participating in the games. Starting on Wednesday, Feb. 4, women‚Äôs ice hockey (preliminary rounds and group play) starts at 3:10 a.m. PT/6:10 a.m. ET and broadcasts on NBC, USA Network and CNBC, as well as livestream on Peacock. Related Stories TV How to Watch Chloe Kim Snowboarding at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan Live Online for Free TV How to Watch the 2026 Winter Olympics Live Online At a Glance: How to Watch 2026 Women‚Äôs Ice Hockey at the Winter Olympics Online The simplest way to watch Winter Olympics Women‚Äôs Ice Hockey without cable is by signing']

Name: 12_central bank_federal reserve_florence_meeting
Representative_Docs: ['Florence Press Conference Confirms ECB Remains Comfortable in Its Good Place Even a change of scenery has done nothing to change the European Central Bank‚Äôs current wait-and-see stance. Florence, where the ECB met today for its only annual meeting outside of Frankfurt, is apparently also this ‚Äôgood place‚Äô, the central bank‚Äôs well-known pseudonym for comfortably keeping interest rates on hold. ECB President Christine Lagarde even called it a ‚Äòmagnificent‚Äô place ‚Äì Florence, that is, not rates. The comments at the press conference confirmed once again that the ECB has no intention to leave its ‚Äògood place‚Äô any time soon. We had feared a rather uneventful press conference. What should we say? We hate to be right‚Ä¶ Anyhow, here are a few interesting remarks made by Lagarde: On the ECB‚Äôs risk assessment, the introductory statement had the most remarkable change compared with September. Last month, the ECB had still talked about risks to the growth outlook that had become ‚Äúmore balanced‚Äù; today, it refrained from qualifying any balance of risk. Instead, the central bank had a somewhat more extensive list of upside and downside risks to the growth outlook. Lagarde even said that some of the downside risks had abated.
